 also likely reflects a nonobstructing stone.  Otherwise, the kidneys appear
 unremarkable.

 The stomach and small bowel are normal.  There is diverticulosis of the colon
 without evidence of diverticulitis.

 Atherosclerotic calcifications of the abdominal aorta are present, with slight
 ectasia of the infrarenal abdominal aorta.

 There is a collection of fluid within the left lower abdomen, tracking along
 the left anterior abdominal wall, directly abutting the left lateral abdominal
 wall musculature anterolaterally, and extending posteriorly to directly abut
 the left psoas muscle.  This collection measures approximately 10 Hounsfield

after surgery. You have been given medication to help with this
issue.

for comfort when you are walking. You may take it off when
sitting in a chair or while lying in bed.

draining cover it with a new sterile dressing. If it is dry then
you can leave the incision open to the air. Once the incision is
completely dry (usually 2-3 days after the operation) you may
take a shower. Do not soak the incision in a bath or pool. If
the incision starts draining at anytime after surgery, do not
get the incision wet. Cover it with a sterile dressing. Call the
office.

NSAIDs.

pain. Please allow 72 hours for refill of narcotic

for 90 days from the date of surgery.
